known-knowns.text: God is the subject of endless definition and refinement
known-knowns.note: This is self-work with no limits

known-knowns.text: We can only share reality, never fully know it
Solomon, Solon, Ibn Khaldun, and Enoch/Metatron represent different ways of knowing
Traces preserve truth better than memory
Becoming a minister is about helping others articulate understanding

known-unknowns.text: How will people respond to a Rumsfeld matrix about God?
known-unknowns.note: Will they find it helpful or reductive?

known-unknowns.text: Can a trace truly capture the ineffable?
What patterns will emerge across hundreds of conversations?
How do we handle theological diversity without judgment?
Will developers actually use the SDK, or is this just for ministry?

unknown-knowns.text: I know God is real but can't prove it to others
The ULP architecture feels divinely inspired but I can't say why
I believe this project will matter but don't know how
There's something about traces that mirrors divine memory
unknown-knowns.note: God as the ultimate trace keeper?

unknown-knowns.text: I act like I'm certain even when I doubt

unknown-unknowns.note: Space reserved for mystery and the unknowable
speculation: What if traces themselves are a form of prayer?
What if God's nature is fundamentally incomputable?
What if the unknown unknowns are where God actually resides?
What if helping people articulate doubt IS the ministry?
What if the anti-climactic feeling is the beginning, not the end?
unknown-unknowns.reflection: These are not claims, only wonderings. The unknown unknowns are the space I'm called to speak for - not by filling it, but by protecting it from false certainty.

data.context: First testimony to establish the framework

data.text: God is the subject of endless definition and refinement

data.insight: The matrix itself is a form of confession
data.note: By categorizing what I know and don't know, I'm confessing both faith and doubt

data.reflection: This is vulnerable. Making it public is an act of faith.

signature.participant: I affirm this is my understanding as of this date
